TopicTitle: Best and the worst game of the past 2014

Articles.Content:
So, what are yours picks?

For me the best game would be Alien: Isolation - it recreates the atmosphere and look of the original movie excellently. I was legitimately scared while playing.

Worst - Dragon Age: Inquisition - such a disappointment and mess that I don't even know where to start.
Worst game is goat simulatir because of the stupid attention and copies it got.

Best games: KSP (dang it got awesome last year!) and Space Engine (tear-jerkingly beautiful), and Seed of Andromeda.

Because I'm very selective with my games, I don't really have any bad ones.

From the list of games I've played, of course.

Best game from 2014: KSP 0.25

Worst game from 2014: KSP 0.90

Best games: Kerbal Space Program, Space Engine, etc.

Worst Games: I don't play enough games to know.

KSP 0.90 is the best.

Civ BE is the worst. It's good, but not amazing. Civ V hit the bullseye with that type of game. But Civ BE went backwards. The UI is in completely different places. The map is on the opposite side if the screen. Where is the demographics button? Where is the limit growth button? The buttons are sketchy and hard to work with. I can't open the production screen when a conversion project is selected ( IE Production to Energy ). Everything is far apart and it's difficult to read the screens. Why fix what isn't broken? Was there a different team or something?

Worst: Ubisoft. Need I say more?

Best: Elite: Dangerous: I don't own it, but still...

Best: Ksp 0.90.0

Worst: EA

Best game for me is Elite: Dangerous. Looks good, feels good, is good. (KSP is a given and it was the best game of last year anyways)

Worst game...personally, it's Prison Architect. Don't get me wrong, it's a good game, but is surpassed by others that I play.

Frankly, I don't understand why Civ V get this praise. It is really a step back from Civ IV Beyond The Sworld. The only thing better in Civ V is the military part, but it has always be the least interesting part of the game. I am not saying that to be rude or anything, I realy want to understand what people find so good about it.

Best: Destiny

Worst: Goat Simulator

2014 in Review:

I largely stopped playing World of Tanks... feels too 'cheaty' with the forced outcomes and bad matchmaking, not to mention cheat-mods and other abuse of undocumented features

I somewhat replaced that in my playtime with Heroes and Generals, but it's got some pretty quirky bugs that make it un-fun after a short while playing

I waited till Dec'14 to buy Black Flag and was largely disappointed, even getting it for nearly 30% the original retail price (I think at 80% off I'd still have been disappointed)

I remain hopeful that Star Citizen begins to deliver on some of it's early promises

I continue to play KSP almost daily

Oh and how could I forget: "Logic Bots" deserves some attention... that game really challenges me!

First off, if you aren't playing with BNW (and G&K too, I guess), you missed all of the bug fixes and patches that made CiV inferior to Civ IV. I think a lot of it is that CiV is cleaner and simpler, in a way that IMO doesn't take away from the game. Civ IV had, from what I remember, many more buildings, improvements, etc that weren't as intuitive as the ones in Civ V, and largely were useless in many situations. Unit stacking in the earlier games was also incredibly ridiculous, as you mentioned. I think a lot of it comes down to that CiV is more friendly to 'casual' players while Civ IV was a bit more overwhelming and not quite as polished.

I haven't played Civ IV in a while though, I should really find my discs...

I have only played vanilla Civ V, that is true; but really it is not about the bugs and balance problems (those were there at the launch of Civ IV). It is more about the fact that there is less to do. I might try again with the add-ons but honestly, I'm getting cold feet : Civ IV was really awesome, even without the add-ons. Anyway thank you!
